A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Last Jedi brings brand new premises to the Starwars legacy. Bold new choices for new and old characters\, expansion of existing lore\, and creative solutions all add a very distinct sense of new-ness to Star Wars that many argued was missing from TFA.

This movie isn't perfect. It wont make you feel the way you expect a Star Wars movie to. It wont answer all your questions\, and what it does answer might not be as satisfying as you wanted.
In a lot of ways\, it's a polar opposite of its recent predecessors.  TFA & R1 immediately grabbed the audience and thrilled them\, but started to show serious cracks over time.

TLJ may have been unsettling for many viewers\, but I do believe the new expansion of the universe\, it's rules and inhabitants\, and the complex themes will grow on you with time.

It is a must-see for any Star Wars fan\, but you probably wont walk out of the theater without some serious mixed feelings.
